overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains a presence across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research related to computational social science, disinformation, and information operations. LinkedIn has the highest follower count, but engagement is distributed across platforms depending on the content type.

contentThemes.description: Updates on research projects, publications, and tools related to computational social science.
Content focused on studying and detecting disinformation and coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media platforms.
Announcements of job openings, postdoctoral positions, and research opportunities for students.

recommendations: Increase cross-promotion of content across platforms to reach a wider audience.
Engage more actively in conversations and respond to comments to build a stronger community.
Experiment with different content formats (e.g., videos, infographics) to see what resonates best with each audience.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky is used for sharing research publications and conference presentations, with a focus on coordinated inauthentic behavior. Posts mentioning opportunities are well-received.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon is used for announcing new tools and engaging in discussions about methodological approaches to studying disinformation.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn is mainly used for professional announcements like grant awards and job postings, garnering significant likes and comments.
